keyword: how many calories in a california roll
title: How Many Calories in a California Roll?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a california roll, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per roll with easy tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in a California Roll?
assumptions: Standard California roll (6-8 pieces, ~225 g total) with white sushi rice, imitation crab, avocado, cucumber, nori, and rice vinegar; no extra sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by restaurant, brand, portion size, rice type, and added ingredients like mayo or sesame seeds. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One California roll has about 255 kcal, with 38 g carbs and 9 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use brown rice instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a california roll from a restaurant?
faqs.a: Typically 250-300 kcal per roll, depending on size and extras like sauces.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a california roll?
faqs.a: About 38 g carbs per roll, mostly from the rice.

faqs.q: Is a california roll low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 7 g total fat per roll, with avocado as the main source.

faqs.q: How much protein in one california roll?
faqs.a: Roughly 9 g protein, primarily from the imitation crab.

faqs.q: Does a california roll have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, about 500 mg per roll due to seasoned rice and soy elements.
